p: The median age of the 11,398 enrolled pediatric patients was 1.8 years (IQR, 0.8–3.8), indicating the high public health burden among infants and young children, as previously reported [ 33, 34]. Nearly half of all patients had positive test results for one or more of the pathogens of interest; moreover, all pathogens in the panel were detected, indicating the complexity and diversity of ARI etiology (Table 1). Higher pathogen prevalence was found among male patients than female ones ( p = 0.002), similar to previous reports [ 35]. RSV, infA, MP, ADV, HRV, and PIV were the six most frequently detected pathogens in this study (Fig. 1); these results are consistent with previous reports from China as well as international studies [ 1, 2, 35, 36].
